div.pre: 1969 Soverato, 25 km. S. of Catanzaro, (1002) Bruttium, 1914 Burial: early 3rd cent. B.C. (K) Contents: c. 32 AR Lot A Taras: 1 st. (Per. III, H1) Heracleia: 1 diob. (or Taras?) Metapontum: 1 st. (Leucippus) Velia: 7 st. (6 signed >Ε; 1 as SNGOxford 1377) Locri: 2 st. (1 Pegasus; 1 Zeus/eagle) Terina: 1 st. Corinth: 1 Peg. (Per. V) Argos: 2 Peg. (1 eye; 1 ΑΡ ΔΙ shield) Thyrrheium: 1 Peg. (Boeotian shield) Lot B Taras: 1 diob. (Per. V: rev. ΚΛΕ, Κ; Hera- cleia?) Metapontum: 1 st. (as SNGOxford 766) Velia: 9 st. (5 signed >Ε, as SNGOxford 1242, 1246, 1255, 1272, and cf. 1272, but with Φ added above; 4 hd. r. in Attic helmet with griffin/lion and various markings [but no issues signed Φ-Ι]) Croton: 1 st. (eagle/tripod, B) Locri: 1 st. (as SNGOxford 1567) Anactorium: 2 Peg. Disposition: Reggio, Museo Nazionale (Lot A); Lot B unknown Currò Pisanò AIIN 1962-4, pp. 232-3 (ac- cessioned at Syracuse in 1916, but at Reggio in 1969) (Lot A) Listed by K (Lot A) Lot B is part of a hd. shown at ANS in Jan. 1921. The owner reported that 17 more coins from the hd. (incl. one each of Metapontum and Terina) were in the possession of the Italian govern- ment
